xtrememp.player.dsp

Class DigitalSignalSynchronizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • xtrememp.player.dsp.DigitalSignalSynchronizer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, javax.sound.sampled.LineListener

    public class DigitalSignalSynchronizer
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.sound.sampled.LineListener, java.lang.Runnable
    This class provides synchronization between a digital signal processor and speaker output. Based on the KJ-DSS project by Kris Fudalewski at http://fudcom.com/main/libs/kjdss/.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DigitalSignalSynchronizer

        public DigitalSignalSynchronizer()
        Default constructor.

      • DigitalSignalSynchronizer

        public DigitalSignalSynchronizer(int blockLength,
                                 double framesPerSecond)
        Parameters:
        blockLength - The sample size to extract from audio data sent to the SourceDataLine.
        framesPerSecond - The desired refresh rate per second of registered DSP's.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(DigitalSignalProcessor dsp)
        Adds a DSP to the DSS and forwards any audio data to it at the specified frame rate.
        Parameters:
        dsp - A class implementing the DigitalSignalProcessor interface.

      • remove

        public void remove(DigitalSignalProcessor dsp)
        Removes the specified DSP from this DSS if it exists.
        Parameters:
        dsp - A class implementing the DigitalSignalProcessor interface.

        Parameters:

      • writeAudioData

        public void writeAudioData(byte[] audioData,
                           int offset,
                           int length)
        Writes part of specified buffer to the monitored source data line an any registered DSPs.
        Parameters:
        audioData - Data to write.
        offset - Offset to start reading from the buffer.
        length - The length from the specified offset to read.
